meanings.definition: The line behind which a player must stand to throw darts or play a game such as shuffleboard.
meanings.sent1: At the oche, the dart player focused on hitting the bullseye.
meanings.sent2: Players often feel the pressure when they step up to the oche.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the oche line was a fun challenge to jump over.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to reach the oche of success never wavered.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights illuminated the oche, making it the center of attention.

meanings.definition: A wooden or metal bar used as a marker for the starting point in certain games.
meanings.sent1: The oche was placed firmly on the ground to mark the beginning of the race.
meanings.sent2: The players lined up behind the oche, ready to start the game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the oche for a tasty nut and tried to nibble on it.
meanings.sent4: The oche of determination propelled her forward in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The shiny oche gleamed in the sunlight, guiding the players to start.
